title: Need font for Plague
content:
Anyone have suggestions for a font/type face that would represent the word PLAGUE? Something “sick” looking?

 [‹ Type for a mag cover](http://web.archive.org/web/20080504200043/http:/www.typophile.com/node/16199 "Go to previous forum topic") [African fonts ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080504200043/http:/www.typophile.com/node/16083 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Hildebrant

comments.content: Sick looking type? You could always just set it badly! Or mash it up in a drawing programme. There’s always [Caustic Biomorph](http://web.archive.org/web/20080504200043/http:/www.fontshop.com/products/fuse04.cfm) and I have a hunch that out there, somewhere, is lurking a font named ’Ebola’...

what’s the destination? screen or print?

the first thing that came to mind when i saw the word “plague” was the black plague, historically, which made me think “baroque,” and i thought of storm’s beautiful [regula](http://web.archive.org/web/20080504200043/http:/www.stormtype.com/regu.html). (actually, regula is probably too beautiful to be sick.)

but if the context is...i don’t know, say, contemporary germ warfare, then how about one of house industries’ distressed faces, like [housecopy](http://web.archive.org/web/20080504200043/http:/www.houseindustries.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=201&subpage=lettersetter)?
It would be for print. Actually screen printed on jersies. ;) Its the name of a triatholon team — interesting, I know.

[This book](http://web.archive.org/web/20080504200043/http:/www.amazon.co.uk/exec/obidos/ASIN/3899550560/qid=1132229761/sr=2-1/ref=sr_2_11_1/203-9394529-4127160) has an experiment where a type designer had grown culture in petri dishes in the shapes of letters and then made a font on the stages of growth, so as the culture grew the letter became bolder. Unfortunately I don’t have the book to hand so I can’t tell you the designer or the name of the font (if it was released), but it was a fun experiment.  
Tim
